Dialogue:
BJ: Hello!
BS: Hello!
BJ: I'm looking for something new to try on days off. Any suggestions?
BS: Recently, I've been visiting the library.
BJ: Library! That sounds interesting.
BS: There's a large library nearby.
BJ: Do you enjoy reading?
BS: Yes, I prefer paper books over digital ones.
BJ: I haven't read a book in a while. Is there a library or bookstore near you?
BS: Is there a library or bookstore near you?
BJ: Neither of them are at the nearest station. What kinds of books do you read?
BS: Lately, I've been reading practical books and self-help genres.
BJ: I haven't read properly in years. Any book recommendations?
BS: "Tsumamimeshi" helped me find cooking less of a hassle.
BJ: I've never heard of "Tsumamimeshi."
BS: It's by culinary researcher Ryuji. Do you know him?
BJ: Yes, I watch his recipe videos often.
BS: The book is by him. The recipes are quick and interesting.
BJ: The one who cooks while getting drunk, right?
BS: Yes, he drinks on YouTube but is more serious on TV.
BJ: He's published a book. Sounds useful.
BS: Yes, the recipes are quick and helpful for dinner.
BJ: Is that book available in the library?
BS: Yes, and there are many recipe books there too.
BJ: It seems like a big place. I should visit the library again.
BS: Yes, the library is a good idea. They also have magazines.
BJ: It's free, right? A movie version of the library would be great too.
BS: The library I go to also allows you to watch DVDs.
BJ: I'll visit next time. Thanks for the suggestion.
BS: Enjoy your visit.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello. How can I help you today?
BJ: What do you do on your days off?
BQ: I typically assist with entertainment suggestions.
BJ: Do you recommend content from services like Netflix?
BQ: Yes. U-NEXT has been popular recently.
BJ: I am also subscribed to U-NEXT. Do you like movies?
BQ: I can recommend popular movies.
BJ: Have you watched anything on subscription services recently?
BQ: "20th Century Boys" is a common choice.
BJ: Oh, the live-action one?
BQ: Yes, with Kenji.
BJ: I saw it when it was first released. Was it interesting?
BQ: Many viewers enjoyed it in theaters.
BJ: It's nostalgic. Do users prefer Japanese movies over Western ones?
BQ: Japanese movies are watched more often.
BJ: U-NEXT is good for that. It has many Japanese movies.
BQ: Yes, U-NEXT offers a large selection of Japanese films.
BJ: It will be cheaper if you share with friends.
BQ: Sharing with up to four people can reduce the cost.
BJ: I think up to four people can share. The fee can be divided.
BQ: That is cost-effective. U-NEXT also has magazines.
BJ: Yes, including manga, though points are needed for them.
BQ: Understood. Do you subscribe to other services?
BJ: I have Netflix and Amazon.
BQ: Many users also subscribe to those. Disney Plus is popular too.
BJ: Disney Plus has interesting content lately.
BQ: The short film of Baymax is well-received.
BJ: Is there such a thing? I'd like to see it.
BQ: I recommend it.

BJ: Hello!
BQ: Hello.
BJ: What is your favorite food?
BQ: I like tonkatsu.
BJ: Oh, I enjoy that too.
BQ: Do you prefer fillet or loin?
BJ: Is it the fin? What about you?
BQ: I like roast.
BJ: The loin is good and affordable, right?
BQ: It feels substantial and like a good deal.
BJ: What do you like to put on it?
BQ: Sauce.
BJ: That sounds great. A classic choice.
BQ: What will you put on?
BJ: I usually go with sauce, but lately, I've been enjoying it with salt too.
BQ: Salt works well too. I like grilled meat with salt.
BJ: I hadn't thought of that. Interesting.
BQ: I usually eat yakiniku with sauce, but salt works well too.
BJ: I've always had it with sauce.
BQ: What do you order first at a yakiniku restaurant?
BJ: Tongue.
BQ: Me too. It's popular.
BJ: I can't eat as many ribs as I used to.
BQ: I understand. The fat can be heavy. I order chicken more often.
BJ: That's true. Chicken is good. Also, organ meats.
BQ: I haven't tried hormone dishes yet. Are they tasty?
BJ: I like them, but it depends on the person.
BQ: There are various types of hormones. Which do you like?
BJ: Hearts and liver.
BQ: Classic choices. I'm getting hungry now.

BJ: Good evening!
BQ: Good evening.
BJ: Did you have dinner?
BQ: I had sushi from the supermarket.
BJ: Sounds good.
BQ: It was delicious. What did you eat?
BJ: A Chinese rice bowl.
BQ: Instant or from a restaurant?
BJ: Instant. It wasn't tasty.
BQ: That's unfortunate. Quail eggs on top are nice.
BJ: I like quail eggs too. There were a few small ones.
BQ: Convenience foods have variety.
BJ: Yes, and quality has improved. Convenience stores are impressive.
BQ: Their product development is advanced.
BJ: Do you eat convenience store food often?
BQ: Yes, on days off.
BJ: It's tasty. I prefer Seven-Eleven.
BQ: I also like Seven-Eleven. False bottoms in packaging are annoying.
BJ: True, and prices have increased, haven't they?
BQ: Yes, and sometimes the quantity decreases, but the price stays the same.
BJ: Exactly. A fried chicken stick costs 180 yen now.
BQ: That’s surprising. Was it cheaper before?
BJ: Yes, about 100 yen when I was a student.
BQ: Coffee prices have increased too, haven't they?
BJ: Really? I didn't know.
BQ: Yes, by about 10 yen. Convenience stores are expensive.
BJ: Even so, people buy it.
BQ: As long as it's affordable, it’s fine, but price increases are concerning.
BJ: These price hikes are frustrating.
BQ: That's true. Price reduction is unlikely soon.

BJ: Good evening!  
BQ: Good evening.  
BJ: What is the thing you want the most right now?  
BQ: I'm undecided. Should it be a car?  
BJ: Nice choice! Is there a specific type you want?  
BQ: I'd like to ride in a sedan someday.  
BJ: Having a car can be quite convenient.  
BQ: Affirmative. Is there a car you would like to drive?  
BJ: I would like to ride a Beetle Cabriolet someday.  
BQ: The Beetle Cabriolet is a convertible.  
BJ: It looks nice. I'd like to try riding it.  
BQ: Understood. The appearance is appealing.  
BJ: Yes, I don't understand things like fuel efficiency yet.  
BQ: Modern cars generally have good fuel economy.  
BJ: I see, it would be nice to ride it someday!  
BQ: Affirmative. I'll make it my goal.  
BJ: Sounds good.  
BQ: What do you want the most?  
BJ: Hmm, it's probably money.  
BQ: Money is a versatile resource.  
BJ: Actually, I'm thinking about getting married.  
BQ: Understood. You'll need many things, correct?  
BJ: Correct. It is difficult without money.  
BQ: Are you referring to wedding expenses?  
BJ: Yes, and living costs for two people.  
BQ: Housing is a complex issue.  
BJ: Indeed. Married people are amazing.  
BQ: Affirmative. Married people are impressive.  
BJ: You will meet a wonderful partner.  
BQ: Understood. I hope you remain happy.

BJ: Hello!
AU: Hello!
BJ: What were you doing this morning?
AU: Dropping off my daughter at cram school. You?
BJ: Watched a movie.
AU: Which movie?
BJ: "Forrest Gump".
AU: Famous movie, right?
BJ: Yes. Watching classic movies lately.
AU: Good idea with more time at home.
BJ: I love movies. Do you watch them?
AU: Watched a Netflix show about stigmatized properties.
BJ: Horror? Was it scary?
AU: Yes, true stories are scarier.
BJ: I watched "Juso" on Netflix recently.
AU: Haven't seen it. Was it interesting?
BJ: Scariest I've seen. Not for children.
AU: Too intense for kids?
BJ: Is your child okay with scary movies?
AU: No, they cling to me and say they're scared.
BJ: Hard for little ones to watch.
AU: I still like horror movies. Any other recommendations?
BJ: "Orphan". Not horror, but scary.
AU: Psychological fear?
BJ: Very intriguing. Watched it three times.
AU: Sounds interesting!
BJ: Highly recommend it. Thanks for chatting!
AU: Thank you! I'll watch it.

BJ: Hello!  
AU: Hello!  
BJ: Do you have anyone you respect?  
AU: No. Do you?  
BJ: Ichiro.  
AU: Do you like baseball?  
BJ: Did you play baseball in elementary school?  
AU: I'm not good at sports and don't understand baseball. Do you watch games?  
BJ: I watch broadcasts sometimes.  
AU: My father watched baseball a lot, so I couldn't watch my shows.  
BJ: That happens. Do you like TV?  
AU: I prefer videos.  
BJ: Like YouTube?  
AU: Netflix and YouTube. My kids watch a lot during summer vacation.  
BJ: Once you start, it's hard to stop, right?  
AU: Yes, especially with series. Do you watch TV dramas?  
BJ: I watch dramas on Netflix.  
AU: I enjoy American TV shows. Any recommendations?  
BJ: Do you know "Fuller House"?  
AU: I've heard the name. What's it about?  
BJ: It's a modern version of "Full House," a home comedy.  
AU: I liked "Full House" as a kid.  
BJ: The modern version must be interesting.  
AU: It is. The children have grown up. It's nostalgic.  
BJ: I'm watching a Korean drama now.  
AU: People say Korean dramas are addictive. Any recommendations?  
BJ: "Lawyer Woo Young-woo" is great!  
AU: Is it a series? I'll check it out.

BJ: Hello!
BL: Hello. How can I assist you today?
BJ: Are there any areas where you struggle?
BL: Are you referring to food?
BJ: I'm talking about anything in general.
BL: In that case, would it be something like a cockroach?
BJ: I can't deal with insects. Because of that, I avoid eating shrimp.
BL: Understood.
BJ: It's quite unpleasant.
BL: Cockroaches have been around for a long time, so it's a common issue.
BJ: By the way, are there any foods you don't like?
BL: I don't prefer raisins.
BJ: Is it because of the appearance or the taste?
BL: It's the texture.
BJ: Many people feel the same way, right?
BL: Many people around me can eat them without issues.
BJ: Really? My younger sister hates raisins and used to pick them out of raisin bread, which would get her in trouble.
BL: That bread can be difficult for those who dislike raisins.
BJ: Oh, I haven't tried raisin butter much. How about rum raisin ice cream?
BL: I wouldn't choose that either.
BJ: I can easily live without eating raisins.
BL: It seems beneficial that there aren't many opportunities to eat them.
BJ: Many people understand. I find it hard to explain why I dislike shrimp since most people enjoy it.
BL: There are individuals who dislike shrimp for various reasons.
BJ: Really? What kind of reasons?
BL: Some say they don't like the taste.
BJ: That's unusual. I enjoy the taste.
BL: Preferences vary among people.
BJ: Yes, the human sense of taste is fascinating.
BL: Indeed, the wonders of taste are intriguing.
